events: 24 Hour Events:,   Transferred to the ICU overnight for fluid responsive hypotension after,   being admitted to the medical floor for concern of a lower extremity,   peri-laceration skin infection.  Fell, injured leg 10 days ago.  Wound,   sutured and placed on keflex.  Came back earlier this week for suture,   removal, area around laceration erythematous with some discharge.  Abx,   changed to Bactrim.  On day of admission developed fever/rigors and,   presented to the ED.,   In ICU overnight, has remained normo/hypertensive.,   History obtained from [**Hospital 15**] Medical records,
